definition: winner/lucky guy/person who always gets good breaks

sentences.english: You don't need me to explain the luck, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 關於幸運之神眷顧，我猜完全用不着解釋了。

sentences.english: The lucky winner enjoys his choice of wives and lovers.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的優勝者可以有權選擇不止一位妻子和愛人。

sentences.english: Luckily, it's very straight-forward and takes less than half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，這是非常直接的，並考慮不到一個半小時。

sentences.english: Fortunately, most people in the world really are good parents.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，世界上大多數父母都是好父母。

sentences.english: The footsteps of fortune are slippery.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的腳步是滑溜溜的。

sentences.english: Today，I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我想我是這個世界上最幸運的人。

sentences.english: We find the bus stop, which fortunately has a dumpling'n'soup lady present.
sentences.chinese: 我們找到了車站，很幸運的那裏有一個賣餃子的女士。

sentences.english: Susan has 'luck' with ferns. No one can grow them like her.
sentences.chinese: 蘇珊在蕨草方面很幸運，沒有人能像她那樣種活他們。

sentences.english: It was my good fortune to be linked with Madame Curie through twenty years of sublime and unclouded friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我幸運地同居裏夫人有20年崇高而真摯的友誼。

sentences.english: Luckily for you, GDI also comes equipped with Hammerheads.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，GDI還配有錘頭鯊。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the temple is believed to have escaped any damage.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，神廟毫髮無傷。

sentences.english: However, we may not be so fortunate in the future, experts warned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，專家警告，將來我們就不會這麼幸運了。

sentences.english: Here is a voucher for your lucky score.
sentences.chinese: 這是給您的贈券，因爲您打了個幸運分。

sentences.english: Fortunately, phobias are among the most treatable of all psychological conditions.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，恐懼症是最好治療的心理疾病之一。

sentences.english: Arculli says. 'Relative to the effort we've spent, we've been lucky.
sentences.chinese: 相對於我們所付出的努力，我們已經是幸運的了。

sentences.english: What area have you put yourself in a position to “get lucky” in?
sentences.chinese: 你把自己放在一個怎樣的位置，將幸運“請進門”來？

definition: to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to be capable of/to be able to/can
